title.rendered: Minecraft: The Microsoft account in the Java edition will be mandatory from March 10th

content.rendered:
Back in October 2020, Microsoft and Mojang Studios announced that a Microsoft account would become mandatory for all players using the Java Edition of Minecraft in the foreseeable future. With the merger, Microsoft not only wants to implement a single account for all Minecraft games, but also significantly improve security for the players. After a good year and a half, the period of voluntary migration is now coming to an end.

Beginning March 10, Minecraft Java Edition developers will require the use of a classic Microsoft account, and anyone who hasn’t switched by then will not be able to play the Java Edition until the migration is complete. The switch itself will only take a few minutes and all important things like skins, creations, the username or progress will be taken over. But you can still get the promised cape afterwards.

Mojang has summarized important questions about the changeover in an FAQ.
